00007 /* Close fd and _try_ to get a /dev/null for it instead.
00008  * Returns 0 on success and -1 on failure (fd gets closed in all cases)
00009  */

00019 #define REMOVE_PATH_FROM_FILE 1
00020 #if REMOVE_PATH_FROM_FILE
00021 LI_API const char *remove_path(const char *path);
00022 #define REMOVE_PATH(file) remove_path(file)
00023 #else
00024 #define REMOVE_PATH(file) file
00025 #endif
00026 
00027 // TODO: perhaps make portable (detect if cc supports)
00028 #define __ATTRIBUTE_PRINTF_FORMAT(fmt, arg) __attribute__ ((__format__ (__printf__, fmt, arg)))
00029 
00030 #define ERROR(fmt, ...) \
00031         log_trace("(error) (%s:%d) "fmt, REMOVE_PATH(__FILE__), __LINE__, __VA_ARGS__)
00032 
00033 #define TRACE(fmt, ...) \
00034         log_trace("(trace) (%s:%d) "fmt, REMOVE_PATH(__FILE__), __LINE__, __VA_ARGS__)
00035 
00036 #define SEGFAULT(fmt, ...) \
00037         do { \
00038                 log_trace("(crashing) (%s:%d) "fmt, REMOVE_PATH(__FILE__), __LINE__, __VA_ARGS__); \
00039                 VALGRIND_PRINTF_BACKTRACE(fmt, __VA_ARGS__);\
00040                 abort();\
00041         } while(0)
00042 LI_API int log_trace(const char *fmt, ...) __ATTRIBUTE_PRINTF_FORMAT(1, 2);
00043 #endif
